sentences.sContent: Church bells tolled and black flags fluttered.
sentences.sCn: 教堂丧钟敲响了，黑旗飘动着。

sentences.sContent: ...but may take a toll on Mom...
...Through careful preparation，the death toll from a super tropical storm in November 2007 was less than 3...
...are beginning to emerge in this bruising environment: Americans are becoming aware of the toll their jobs take on them...
...Figures are not yet available but it is believed that the death toll could be as high as 300...

phrases.pCn: 产生负面影响；造成损失
免费通行；受话方付费电话
收费场站，收费广场；缴费广场

remMethod.val: 机动交通工具(tool)得交过路费(toll)

words.tran: 关卡；征收通行税的关卡
鸣钟人；征收通行税的人；钟

trans.tranOther: if a large bell tolls, or if you toll it, it keeps ringing slowly, especially to show that someone has died

trans.tranCn: 过路费，过桥费；伤亡人数，损失
trans.tranOther: the number of people killed or injured in a particular accident, by a particular illness etc
